functions.name: abs
functions.description:
Returns the IEEE absolute value of a decimal value.

```ballerina
decimal d = -3.21;
d.abs() ⇒ 3.21
```

returnParameters.description: smallest (closest to -∞) decimal value not less than parameter `x` that is a mathematical integer

functions.name: ceiling
functions.description:
Rounds a decimal up to the closest integral value.

```ballerina
decimal d = 3.51;
d.ceiling() ⇒ 4
```

returnParameters.description: largest (closest to +∞) decimal value not greater than parameter `x` that is a mathematical integer.

functions.name: floor
functions.description:
Rounds a decimal down to the closest integral value.

```ballerina
decimal d = 3.51;
d.floor() ⇒ 3
```

returnParameters.description: decimal representation of the argument or error

functions.name: fromString
functions.description:
Returns the decimal value represented by a string.

`s` must follow the syntax of DecimalFloatingPointNumber as defined by the Ballerina specification
with the following modifications
- the DecimalFloatingPointLiteral may have a leading `+` or `-` sign
- a FloatingPointTypeSuffix is not allowed
This is the inverse of function ``value:toString`` applied to an `decimal`.

```ballerina
decimal:fromString("0.2453") ⇒ 0.2453
decimal:fromString("-10") ⇒ -10
decimal:fromString("123d") ⇒ error
```

returnParameters.description: maximum value of parameter `x` and all the parameter `xs`

functions.name: max

returnParameters.description: minimum value of parameter `x` and all the parameter `xs`.

functions.name: min

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: decimal value from which to get the quantum

functions.name: quantize
functions.description:
Return a decimal with a specified value and exponent.
Return a decimal value that has the same value (except for rounding) as the first
argument, and the same exponent as the second argument.
This is the IEEE quantize operation.

```ballerina
decimal d = 4.1626;
d.quantize(3.512) ⇒ 4.163
decimal:quantize(4.1626, 3.512) ⇒ 4.163
decimal:quantize(4.1624, 3.51) ⇒ 4.16
```

parameters.name: fractionDigits
parameters.description: the number of digits after the decimal point

returnParameters.description: closest decimal value to `x` that is an integral multiple of 10 raised to the power of `-fractionDigits`

functions.name: round
functions.description:
Round a decimal to a specified number of digits.
Returns the decimal value that has an exponent of `-fractionDigits`
and is closest to `x`.
If there are two such values, returns the one whose final digit is even
(this is the round-to-nearest rounding mode, which is the default for IEEE
and for Ballerina).
A value of `fractionDigits` greater than 0 thus corresponds to the number of digits after the decimal
point being `fractionDigits`; a value of 0 for `fractionDigits` rounds to an integer.
Note that IEEE 754 roundToIntegralTiesToEven operation differs from `round` with `fractionDigits` as 0, in that
roundToIntegralTiesToEven will return a value with a positive exponent when the operand has a positive exponent.
Note that `<int>x` is the same as `<int>x.round(0)`.

```ballerina
decimal d = 3.55;
d.round() ⇒ 4
decimal e = 4.55555;
e.round(3) ⇒ 4.556
decimal g = 2.5;
g.round(0) ⇒ 2
decimal h = 3.5;
h.round(0) ⇒ 4
decimal e = 4345.55;
e.round(-3) ⇒ 4E+3
```

returnParameters.description: sum of all the parameter `xs`; 0 if parameter `xs` is empty

functions.name: sum

modules.summary: The `lang.decimal` module corresponds to the `decimal` basic type.
modules.description:
## Module overview

The `lang.decimal` module corresponds to the `decimal` basic type.
The `lang.decimal` module corresponds to the `decimal` basic type.

functions.description:
Returns the IEEE absolute value of a decimal value.

```ballerina
decimal d = -3.21;
d.abs() ⇒ 3.21
```

Rounds a decimal up to the closest integral value.

```ballerina
decimal d = 3.51;
d.ceiling() ⇒ 4
```

Rounds a decimal down to the closest integral value.

```ballerina
decimal d = 3.51;
d.floor() ⇒ 3
```

Returns the decimal value represented by a string.

`s` must follow the syntax of DecimalFloatingPointNumber as defined by the Ballerina specification
with the following modifications
- the DecimalFloatingPointLiteral may have a leading `+` or `-` sign
- a FloatingPointTypeSuffix is not allowed
This is the inverse of function ``value:toString`` applied to an `decimal`.

```ballerina
decimal:fromString("0.2453") ⇒ 0.2453
decimal:fromString("-10") ⇒ -10
decimal:fromString("123d") ⇒ error
```

Return a decimal with a specified value and exponent.
Return a decimal value that has the same value (except for rounding) as the first
argument, and the same exponent as the second argument.
This is the IEEE quantize operation.

```ballerina
decimal d = 4.1626;
d.quantize(3.512) ⇒ 4.163
decimal:quantize(4.1626, 3.512) ⇒ 4.163
decimal:quantize(4.1624, 3.51) ⇒ 4.16
```

Round a decimal to a specified number of digits.
Returns the decimal value that has an exponent of `-fractionDigits`
and is closest to `x`.
If there are two such values, returns the one whose final digit is even
(this is the round-to-nearest rounding mode, which is the default for IEEE
and for Ballerina).
A value of `fractionDigits` greater than 0 thus corresponds to the number of digits after the decimal
point being `fractionDigits`; a value of 0 for `fractionDigits` rounds to an integer.
Note that IEEE 754 roundToIntegralTiesToEven operation differs from `round` with `fractionDigits` as 0, in that
roundToIntegralTiesToEven will return a value with a positive exponent when the operand has a positive exponent.
Note that `<int>x` is the same as `<int>x.round(0)`.

```ballerina
decimal d = 3.55;
d.round() ⇒ 4
decimal e = 4.55555;
e.round(3) ⇒ 4.556
decimal g = 2.5;
g.round(0) ⇒ 2
decimal h = 3.5;
h.round(0) ⇒ 4
decimal e = 4345.55;
e.round(-3) ⇒ 4E+3
```
